intro: Lippia geisseana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Lippia geisseana is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
